title: Justin Bieber apologises after shouting "f**k you" at a reporter who asked him to say hello to his fans
text:

Justin Bieber had a rather rude response for a TV reporter who asked him to send a message to his fans - but it's never too late to say sorry. 
The Canadian pop star was approached by a news crew during his stay on a private Sunshine Coast island in Australia and flipped them the bird while shouting "f**k you". 
Justin has since made light of the situation in an Instagram video, saying he was merely imitating Jonah from Tonga, a character played by Chris Lilley on the comedy show Summer Heights High. Read More Justin flipped the bird (Photo: Splash News) He was asked to send a message to his fans (Photo: Splash News) He posted a video on Instagram explaining what he actually said (Photo: Splash News) He says it was just a joke (Photo: Splash News) 
Speaking in a Tongan accent, Justin said: "I said 'puck you', miss! There's a difference between bullying him and joking around. I was joking around." 
Justin, 23, addressed the reporter directly in the caption that sits alongside the video. 
The chart-topping star wrote: "SORRY BEN - If you don't get the context its from an Australian TV show called 'Summer Heights High'. (sic)" Read More Justin was at a luxury resort in Queensland (Photo: Splash News) Justin showed off his tattooed torso (Photo: Splash News) Is it too late now to say sorry? (Photo: Splash News) 
However, Justin subsequently went on to send more abuse in the direction of the reporter and the "news lady" who reported the incident. 
Again adopting the persona of Jonah, he said: "Sorry Ben! Motherf***r! (sic)" 
Justin later added: "I was doing it for fun. You just didn't get that it was fun. You on your period or what, miss?" It sounded like he shouted "f**k you" (Photo: Splash News) Justin was hanging out with pals on Makepeace Island (Photo: Splash News) He was relaxing in Australia (Photo: Splash News) 
Justin has rarely been out of the headlines during his tour of Australia, where it was recently reported he hand-picked a dozen models to party with during a late-night cruise. 
All of the women were asked to sign a non-disclosure agreement and surrender their phones before boarding his boat. 
Roze Cook and Nyssa Large, who Justin follows on Instagram, were among the 12 glamorous girls hand-picked for the three-hour trip, but Justin returned to his hotel alone after his boat docked after midnight early on Sunday morning. Like us on Facebook
